He has been working for this company for one year, and he is married. He has had 4 loans with [the field partner] CEPRODEL and each one has enabled him to buy construction materials and improve his house. He is seeking this loan to buy construction materials and a washing-machine. These loans with CEPRODEL have benefited him enormously, because they have meant he has improved his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and household appliances.

loans.name: But

texts.en: Mrs. But N. currently makes rattan furniture. She is 28 years of age and is a resident of Kompong Tom province which is located about 200km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She lives with a young child who goes to school. N. has a life partner in her husband, who is shown in the photo here, and who also assists her in the rattan trade. N. and her husband also cultivate crops on their own farmland from which they often receive extra income. This season is good for planting so N. is requesting a loan to use towards growing new crops.

loans.use: To use towards growing new crops.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Mrs. Ek A., shown in the photo, is 50 years of age and a married womA.. Since early 2009 she has been a grocery trader who sells various items from her store in front of her home. Additionally, Ek A. will work in the field during the coming growing crop season. She currently lives with her husband and three single children, while another four of her children have already married and have their own apartments to live in. Mrs. Ek A. lacks capital to continue investing in her business and is asking for a loA. in order to buy more grocery inventories to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a resident of Kasur, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and famous for its tanneries industry. She supports her family financially by operating a small grocery shop near her home. She provides her customers daily use items at cheap rates. 

Her husband, A., has a construction supplies business. He sells construction supplies through his shop which is located in the market where he deals with good customers every day. His business is going well and gives him good profit on a monthly basis. 
 
Kosar is the mother of two sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her grocery shop business. With the loan, she will put more grocery items such as cooking oil, spices, soaps and rice, etc. in her grocery shop and increase her sales. She started doing this business three years ago and now she is confident that her business will grow well after this loan investment. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes it will be a good experience for her in improving her business.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita F. is from the village of Santa Rosa. She is 49 years old. Perlita is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $40 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Perlita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida N. is from the village of Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 60 years old. Zenaida is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $875 per harvest.

In 2008, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services needed to increase crop yield. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  Sra. Sonia Del Carmen P. Rostran es originario del municipio Santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de León donde tiene más de 21 año de laborar  como Auxiliar de Enfermería en el MINSA de esta localidad.
Cuenta con su propia casa de habitación  la que piensa mejorar con el financiamiento otorgado por la institución. 
Esto le permitirá a la clienta   mejorar las  condiciones de su casa de habitación.
texts.en: Señora Sonia Del Carmen P. Rostran comes from the town of Santa Rosa Del Peñón, in the León region, where for more than 21 years she has worked as a nursing assistant in the state hospital. She has her own house, which she is planning to improve with the loan granted by this institution [the field partner CEPRODEL]. This will permit our client to improve the conditions in her home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Arlen Marcela

texts.es: La Sra. Arlen M. es originaria del municipio de Telica, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Monseñor Bosco Vivas del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 10 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc con el objetivo de construir un cuarto.
texts.en: Arlen M. is originally from Telica and currently works as an elementary school teacher in the Monseñor Bosco Vivas school, in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón.  She's been working there for 10 years.  This will be her first loan through Ceprodel and she will use it to make improvements to her home.  She will use the money to buy bricks, cement, sand, and zinc metal sheeting in order to build a room.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan N. is from the village of Santa Rosa. She is 30 years old. Joan is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Joan is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a resident of Kasur which is a small city located in Punjab and famous for its tanneries industry in Pakistan.  She has lived there in a 2 room brick house with her family for the last 8 years. She is an embroidery expert. She does different kinds of embroidery on clothes by special order. She is very creative in nature and crafts unique embroider designs which attract customers towards her work. Due to her quality work she receives  regular orders every month. 

She is a mother of a daughter who is studying in 5th grade. She is very dedicated and sincere with her family and work and gives the required time and attention to them. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroider items such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity for her embroidery business. She has been doing this work for the last 10 years and is very confident that this investment will give a good result to her business.  She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application
.  
Note: “In this photo, the group member Rasoolan is showing her bangles selling business”.

loans.use: To buy supplies for an embroidery business

loans.name: Gabriela Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela C. es originaria del municipio de Telica, actualmente se desempeña como profesora de secundaria en el colegio José de la Cruz Mena del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 8 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de cerámica y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Gabriela C. is from the municipality of Telica. She works as a high school teacher at the high school José de la Cruz Mena in the town of Santa Rose del Peñón.  She has worked there for 8 years.  This is her first loan with Ceprodel and she will use the money to buy ceramics and pay for labor to improve her home.

loans.use: Buying clay, cement, and paying labor expenses

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Francisco tiene más de 29 año de laborar como chofer en el MINSA de esta localidad.
Cuenta con su propia casa de habitación  la que piensa mejorar con el financiamiento otorgado por la institución. 
Esto le permitirá al cliente mejorar su casa de habitación y ofrecerle a su familia un lugar mejor.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco has spent 29 years working as a driver for the local MINSA office (Ministry of Health).

He has his own home, which he plans to make improvements to, with the financing he receives through the institution.  This will allow him to improve his home and offer a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Darwin Moisés

texts.es: El Sr. Darwin S. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como responsable del Cyber en la Alcaldía de dicho municipio donde tiene 2 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de un televisor de 21” con el objetivo de amueblar su hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Darwin S. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa Del Peñón.  He is currently responsible for the computer support at the city hall and has been there for the past two years.

This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy a 21" television so that he can improve the ambiance in his home.

loans.use: Compra de un TV 21”

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mr. Keo C. is a 39 years old a married man and father. Keo C. currently owns a small furniture selling business. He produces beds and also collects to buy them in bulk from other beds makers who are nearby neighbors. He then sells these beds at retail prices from door-to-door in the community. 

His wife appears on the photo. She is a businesswoman who purchases salt and crops in bulk to resell for a profit. 

Keo C. has been facing difficulty with transportation for years because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. Therefore, Keo C. has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase a used motorbike. Any remaining cash from the loan, he will use to increase the capital of his bed business.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike.

loans.name: Dominga Francisca

texts.es:
La  Sra. Dominga tiene 16 años de laborar como auxiliar de enfermería en el MINSA de esta localidad.
Cuenta con su propia casa de habitación  la que piensa mejorar con el financiamiento otorgado por la institución comprando materiales indispensable para reparar  su vivienda 
Esto le permitirá al cliente ofrecerle a su familia una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dominga has worked for 16 years as a nurse's helper for the local MINSA (Ministry of Health) office.

She has her own home which she plans to improve with the financing she receives through the institution.  She will buy the materials needed to repair the house.  This will allow her to offer better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in Kasur which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and famous for its leather industry. She is a vigorous lady and operates a clothes selling business in order to support her family financially. She purchase clothes from wholesale markets of different cities such as Lahore & Faisalabad and sells it to her local market and area to earn good profit. 

She is married to M. who is a rickshaw driver from trade. He provides transport services to his passengers and drives them to their destinations. 

Safia is the mother of 3 daughters and 2 sons. Only her eldest daughter managed to get an education. Due to poor financial conditions, Safia is unable to send the other children into school. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will buy the unstitched clothing material in bulk quantity. The bulk quantity will minimize her cost of purchase and increase her sales.  
She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy unstitched clothing material in bulk quantity for clothes selling business

loans.name: Ludy Elisa

texts.es: La Sra. Ludy R. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Santa Cruz de la India donde tiene año y medio de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ladrillos y cemento
texts.en: Ludy R. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, where she works as an elementary school teacher at the Santa Cruz de la India school.  She's worked there for a year and a half.  This will be her first loan through Ceprodel and she will use the money to buy bricks and cement so that she can make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El  Sr. Icavalceta es  originario del municipio de El SAUCE comarca el pilón tiempo en que ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente con tres  crédito consecutivo para compra de ternero.
En cuanto a este  financiamiento será utilizado para mejora de su finca  como  asegurar más su finca con el propósito de evitar que se le salgan sus animales y se les pierdan. 
Esto le permitirá al cliente y su familia  tener  mejores condicione de su finca y le rinda su pasto para sus hato ganadero.
texts.en:
Mr. Icavalceta is originally from the El Pilón hamlet of the town of El Sauce, where he has proven to be an excellent client, with three previous loans that he used to buy land.

He will use the money from this loan to make improvements so that his animals will not escape and get lost.  This will allow him and his family to have better conditions on the land and provide grass for his livestock to graze in.

loans.use: Build a fence

loans.name: Delvin Alcides

texts.es: El Sr. Delvin S. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como responsable de servicios municipales en la Alcaldía de dicho municipio donde tiene 2 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Delvin S. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón.  He currently works for the city hall and is responsible for city services.  He has done this for two years.

This will be his first loan through CEPRODEL and he will use the money to buy bricks, cement, sand, and zinc metal sheeting in order to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia M. is from the village of Sta. Rosa. She is 40 years old. Lucrecia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucrecia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lucrecia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Lucrecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucrecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucrecia is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Lucrecia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Majeedan's Group

texts.en:
Majeedan is the resident of Kasur, which is a small city located in Punjab famous for its leather industry in Pakistan. She lives in the area of Jamaat Pura with her family in a 2 room brick house. In orders to support her family financially, Majeedan does embroidery work. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders from her neighbors. Her earning allows her to pay for the utilities expenses of her family. 

Her husband, M. A., has a cycle repair shop in the market. He also provides cycle spare parts to his customers on reasonable rates. 
Majeedan is the mother of a son and a daughter but only her son is able to attend school and is studying in 5th grade. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy spare parts and some of the latest repair tools for his cycle repairing shop. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years and Majeedan is confident that her husband will successfully be able to grow his business with the help of this loan investment. 

Majeedan is a new loan user and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy spare parts & the latest repairing tools for a cycle repair shop

loans.name: Heam

texts.en:
Mr. Heam H., age 27, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboards. He sells rattan that his wife weaves and he also orders from other weavers who live in the village. He uses his old motorcycle witha  trailer attached as transportation and it takes a few days to sell all his rattan. Heam H. has been facing difficulties transporting his rattan because his old vehicle often breaks down and that affects how he can satisfy the needs of his customers. 

Because of this problem, Heam H. decided to request a loan to purchase a vehicle to replace the broken one. Mr. Heam H. was away selling his rattan when the photo was taken, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Magda Lisseth

texts.es: La Sra. Magda M. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como profesora de secundaria en el colegio José de la Cruz Mena donde tiene 9 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de madera, zinc y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Magda M. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón.  She currently works as a junior high school teacher at the José de la Cruz Mena school.  She has worked there for nine years.

This will be her first loan through CEPRODEL and will use the money to buy lumber and zinc metal sheeting, and to pay for labor in order to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Layland

texts.en:
"Layland M. is a single woman who lives in Prk. 1, Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures, an Upholstery Shop and a Food Vending businesses. Layland joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Layland has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to buy refrigerator for her frozen foods  so that she could continue to save up for the future. Layland M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of an upholstery business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: El Sr. Freddy R. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como Asesor legal en la Alcaldía Municipal donde tiene 3 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de computadora e impresora.
texts.en: Freddy R. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as a legal consultant for the city hall.  He has worked there for three years.  This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy a computer and printer.

loans.use: Computer and printer

loans.name: Geline

texts.en:
Geline B. is from the village of Sta. Rosa. She is 42 years old. Geline is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Geline owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice in the local community. Geline has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Geline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Geline is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Geline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of rice to sell

loans.name: Seferino Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Seferino R. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como recolector de impuestos en la Alcaldía de dicho municipio donde tiene 6 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de puertas con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Seferino R. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as a tax collector for the city hall.  He has worked there for six years.  This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy doors so that he can make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Doors

loans.name: Oscar René

texts.es:
El  Sr. F.  es originario del municipio de El Sauce se desempeña como un pequeño comerciante donde tienes dos molinos ubicados en diferentes lugares: comarca San Ramón y  San José a 3 km del Municipio.
En cuanto a este financiamiento lo utilizara para compra de una planta eléctrica.
Lo que le permitirá al  cliente no dejar de funcionar en tiempo de falta de energía y asimismo seguir obteniendo su ingreso para el sustento familiar.
texts.en: Mr. F. is originally from the town of El Sauce.  He is a small businessman who owns two mills in different locations, the San Ramón and San José settlements, 3km from town.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a generator, which will allow his customers to continue to operate when the power goes out, as well as allow him to continue to earn an income with which to support his family.

loans.use: Generator

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita A. is from the village of Sta. Rosa. She is 49 years old. Florita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Florita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Florita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Florita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Florita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a vegetable seller who has been running her business in the market for years. S. normally goes to the big busy market where she orders vegetable in bulk and then hurries to deliver her items by trailer-motorcycle to the other markets where she retails them for a profit. She is married, with four school-aged kids.Her husband also earns income for the family by working in the construction sector. In addition to her job, Mrs. S. also cultivates rice crops on her own farmland. 

S. needs a loan to purchase a new motorbike to make family transportation easier, as well as buying fertilizer to improve her rice crop that is not growing well.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to make family transportation easier, as well as buying fertilizer to improve her rice crop that is not growing well.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia F. is from the village of Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Delia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $82 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. 

Delia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jeanneth De Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Jeanneth A. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como Directora del colegio José de la Cruz Mena donde tiene 24 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda y brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Jeanneth A. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as a school principal at the José de la Cruz Mena school.  She has worked there for 24 years.  This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy floor tiles, cement, sand, and to pay for labor so that she can make improvements to her home and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
La Sra. Olivia L. P. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del peñón, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio José de la cruz mena Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 22 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc con el objetivo de mejora de su vivienda en repello de pared y piso. 
Esta señora tiene 2 hijos a su cargo.
Esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Olivia L. P. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as an elementary school teacher at the José de la Cruz Mena school in town.  She’s been working there for 22 years and is requesting her first loan through CEPRODEL, in order to make improvements to her house.  She will use the money to buy bricks, cement, sand, and zinc metal sheeting so that she can repair a wall and the floor of her home.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Blenda

texts.en:
Blenda M. is from the village of Santa Rosa. She is 30 years old. Blenda is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $62 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Blenda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Blenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jaime Del Socorro

texts.es: El Sr. R. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como maestro de educación primaria en una escuela de la localidad donde tiene ocho años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita para la compra de bloque, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. R. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as an elementary school teacher at a local school.  He has worked there for eight years.  This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, and to pay for labor so that he can make improvements to his home and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Building materials and labor

loans.name: Andrea De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La Sra. Andrea de los Ángeles R. R. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del peñón, actualmente se desempeña como maestra en el colegio José de la cruz mena Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 20 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de, cemento, arena y zinc y mano de obra con el objetivo de mejora de su vivienda en repello de pared y piso. 
Esta señora tiene 2 hijos a su cargo.
Esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Andrea de los Ángeles R. R. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as a school teacher at the José de la Cruz Mena school in town.  She’s been working there for 20 years and is requesting her first loan through CEPRODEL, in order to make improvements to her house.  She will use the money to buy cement, sand, and zinc metal sheeting so that she can repair a wall and the floor of her home.  She has two children to care for.  This will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van N., 64, lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. She works in a grocery store, typically making $5 each day. Her husband stays at home to help his wife sell grocery items. Van N. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to transport groceries from the market to sell at home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en:
Mrs. Teng K. is 58 years old and the mother of five children. One is single and the other four are married and have already started new families. 

Since the beginning of 2005, Teng K. has operated a small store inside the local market. In her shop, she sells a few fishes and vegetables to the buyers who come to buy anything for their cooking. She is married, but her husband died of senility years ago.

In the past, Teng K. hired taxis to travel from and to the market in order to sell her items because she doesn’t have a vehicle. She wants to own a vehicle but her personal money is inadequate to buy one. Thus, Teng K. requests a loan to buy a used motorcycle to be used for traveling without hiring taxis.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for traveling to work

loans.name: Bak

texts.en: Bak S., 56, is married and lives with four of her children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband sell rice and typically make about $2 each day and are supported by three children working in the garment factory. Bak S. is asking for a loan of $250 to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Franklin Xavier

texts.es: El Sr. Franklin G. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como maestro de educación primaria desde hace cinco años. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de piso, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda y asi brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Franklin G. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as an elementary school teacher.  He has worked there for five years.  This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy flooring, cement, sand, and to pay for labor so that he can make improvements to his home and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Building materials and labor

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk R., 46, is married and lives with her four children in the Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband, pictured here, sells traditional medicines making US$4 each day.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have resulted in a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Ouk R. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to expand her farmland. In order to increase her profits and possibly raise her standard of living, she would like to purchase more land to produce rice with the loan given to her through CREDIT.

loans.use: To purchase farmland.

loans.name: Alvaro René

texts.es: El Sr. Álvaro C. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como maestro de educación primaria en el colegio José de la Cruz Mena donde tiene 10 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de cemento, arena, verjas para puertas y pago de mano de obra con el fin de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Álvaro C. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa de Peñón where he works as a primary school teacher in the school José de la Cruz Mena.  He has worked there for 10 years. This is his first loan with Ceprodel and he will use the loan to buy cement, sand, gates for doors, and pay for labor charges to improve his home.

loans.use: Buying cement, sand, gates, and paying for labor

loans.name: Ángela De Los Santos

texts.es:
La Sra. Ángela de los Santos A. M. es originaria del municipio Telica comarca el Ji carito, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 4 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de, Compra de lote. Con el objetivo de Construir su vivienda.
Esta señora tiene 1 hijos a su cargo.
Esto le permitirá llegar a construir su propia casa de habitación donde mejorara el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en: Ángela de los Santos A. M. is originally from the Hamlet of Ji Carito, in the town of Teloca.  She currently works as an elementary school teacher at the Santa Rosa del Peñón school, where she has worked for four years.  This will be her first loan through CEPRODEL and she will use the money to buy a lot on which she can build her home.  This will allow her to have her own home and improver her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Land

loans.name: Yron Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Yron A. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como maestro de educación secundaria en el colegio José de la Cruz Mena del mismo municipio donde tiene tres años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en ceprodel para la compra de un equipo de sonido con el objetivo de amueblar su hogar.
texts.en: Yron A. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as a junior high school teacher at the José de la Cruz Mena school in town.  He has worked there for three years.  This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy sound equipment in order to provide a better surrounding in his home.

loans.use: Sound equipment

loans.name: Oah

texts.en:
Oah B., 50, a widowed farmer who lives with her four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, typically makes US$1 every day and is aided by her daughters who work in a garment factory.

The Kampong Cham area has not seen favorable weather conditions for farming this past year. Along with increased inflation, it has been a difficult year economically in much of Cambodia. As a consequence of these conditions, Oah has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan of US$500 to purchase rice and sell it for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell for a profit

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay L., 27, is married with two young children living at home in the Kampong Chhnang province. She works in a grocery store in front of a garment factory, typicalL. making US $6 each day. Her husband helps her selling groceries. Chhay L. would like a loan of US $600 to purchase a sugar cane squeezer so she can generate more income by selling sugar products.

loans.use: To purchase a sugar cane squeezer

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en: Jero Ayu Putu P. A. is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is married and has a 6-year-old son. She started working straight after junior high school and dreams that her young son will attain a higher education than her own. To make a living, Jero Ayu Putu raises pigs. She started this business 3 months ago. Prior to this, she worked in a shop in a nearby town. She prefers her current farming work as it allows her to work from home. She earns approximately 400,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. In 2010, Jero Ayu Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be her first loan from MUK. Jero Ayu Putu plans to use the additional income to improve and expand her business. Jero Ayu Putu is the leader of a 10 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Dana Kerti" (PK-10335). About MUK The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Jero Ayu Putu P. A. (0) merupakan 27 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Jero Ayu Putu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Dana Kerti (PK-10335). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Jero Ayu Putu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Jero Ayu Putu menghasilkan sekitar 0,400 IDR. Dalam 2010, Jero Ayu Putu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Jero Ayu Putu meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice M. is 32 years old. She is married and has one child who is ten years old and attending school.

Eunice is a dairy farmer from Nyamira town, western Kenya, where she has been farming for seven years. Her farm produces milk that is sold locally. She also earns income from her business of selling ready-made clothes to the local market. Her primary challenges are a poor transport network and a lack of stable markets for her products.

She has requested this loan of 45000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her child and improve the livelihood of her family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming by acquiring other dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mr. Sorn S. and his wife are the good parents of five children. Sorn S. was not available on the day the photo was taken, so his wife was photographed instead. For his daily income, Sorn S. owns a small machine that he uses to provide a rice-milling service to fellow villagers. As another source of family income, his wife raises a few pigs. In order to create additional revenue, Sorn S. is requesting a loan to buy a hundred kilos of rice that he will resell or mill before reselling. Sorn S. is hopeful that the loan will allow him to increaS. his income to make sure that his family attains a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a hundred kilos of rice that he will resell or mill before reselling

loans.name: Claudia Benita

texts.es:
La Sra. Claudia Benita F. M. es originaria del municipio Telica comarca el Ji carito, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 6 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para compra de electro domestico. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de, electro domestico. Con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Esta señora tiene 1 hijos a su cargo.
texts.en: Claudia Benita F. M. is originally from the Hamlet of Ji Carito, in the town of Teloca.  She currently works as an elementary school teacher in Santa Rosa del Peñón, where she has worked for six years.  This will be her first loan through CEPRODEL and she will use the money to buy a domestic appliance so that she can improve her family’s quality of life. She has one son whom she cares for.

loans.use: Home appliance

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan S., 33, a widowed farmer living with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, also raises pigs and typically makes US$10 each day.  The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has been out of control. These factors have resulted in a harsh  year economically for many Cambodians, Yan S. included. She would like to increase her profits and is therefore requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase both fertilizer and pig food.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pig food.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: La Sra. Amparo M. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, su negocio consiste en una pequeña pulpería donde ofrece abarrotería en general donde tiene 17 años de experiencia. Tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado cuatro créditos consecutivos para invertirlos en su negocio. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de granos básicos con el objetivo de surtir su negocio
texts.en: Amparo M. is originally from the town of El Sauce.  Her business consists of a small general store where she has been selling groceries for 17 years.  She’s been working with CEPRODEL for three years and has received four previous loans which she invested into her business.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy basic grains so that she can stock her store.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Darling José

texts.es:
La Sr. Darling José T. T. es originaria del municipio Santa Rosa del peñón comarca el confite actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 6 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de Sin. Con el objetivo de Construir su vivienda.
Esta señor su objetivo es plenamente dedicado a mejorar su hogar.
Esto le permitirá llegar a construir su propia casa de habitación donde mejorara el bien estar de su familia
texts.en: Darling José T. T. is originally from the city of Santa Rosa de Peñón where he works as a primary school teacher. He has worked at the school Santa Rosa del Peñón for 6 years.  This is his first loan with Ceprodel to improve his home. He will use the loan to buy zinc to construct his home. Jose is fully committed to improving his home.  This loan will allow him to construct his own home to improve the well being of his family.

loans.use: Buying Zinc (shingles)

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been practicing mixed farming for 20 years in Nyamira, western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, tea and sorghum which she sells to the local market. A full-time farmer dependent on the income from her farm to meet the needs of her family, her biggest challenge has been poor weather conditions which have affected her production.

Hellen has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 25,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help her improve the living standards of her family. In the future, she would like to buy more land that will enable her expand her farming.

Hellen is 60 years old. She is married with six children who are between the ages of 16 and 36. Her youngest child is currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bol

texts.en: Mrs. Bol P., 43, became a widow when her child was very young. She has been earning a living as a farmer, a skill she learned from her grandparents who passed away years ago. Bol P. has a 20-year-old daughter who shares the family's financial responsibilities by working in a garment factory. Her daughter is married and lives with her in the family home. Bol P. has more land where she plans to build a new house for her daughter and her son-in-law to live in, but she can’t achieve this goal because she does not have enough cash to make it possible. Therefore, Bol P. has requested a loan of 1200 USD to construct a new home. (Bol P. and her grandchild are pictured.)

loans.use: To construct a new home

loans.name: Dania Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Sra. Denia del Carmen A. Treminio. Es originario de la ciudad de león actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en Santa Rosa del Peñón en el colegio Riben Darío donde tiene 4 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de Sin y perlin. Con el objetivo de Construir su vivienda.
Esta señor su objetivo es plenamente dedicado a mejorar su hogar.
Esto le permitirá llegar a construir su propia casa de habitación donde mejorara el bien estar de su familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Denia del Carmen A. T.is originally from the city of Leon but now she works as a primary school teacher in Santa Rosa del 
Peñón, in the Riben Darío school. She has worked there for 4 years. 

This is the first loan she has requested from Ceprodel and it is to improve her home. She would like to buy zinc and other materials in order build a home. This way she will be able to build her own home which will improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy zinc and roofing materials

loans.name: Marizel

texts.es: La Sra. Marizel M. es originaria de la comarca San Nicolás del municipio de Achuapa, se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 20 años. Tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado tres créditos para la compra de ganado y gracias a ello ha ido aumentando su hato ganadero. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de cuatro vacas con el objetivo de seguir aumentando su hato.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marizel M. is originally from the San Nicolás area in the municipality of Achuapa. She has been working with livestock for the last 20 years. 

She has worked with Ceprodel for the last 3 years and has received 3 loans which have helped her to buy livestock. Thanks to the loans she has been able to grow her flock. She is requesting this loan in order to buy 4 cows and continue increasing her flock.

loans.use: To buy 4 cows

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya where he has been farming for twenty years. He sells his horticultural products to the local market. He is also employed. 

Edwin is 40 years old and married with six school-aged children. Four of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 25,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for rabbit-keeping. The proceeds from the sale of rabbits will assist him in paying school fees for his children. His biggest challenge has been a lack of reliable market for rabbits. In the future, he would like to expand his farming and be the leading supplier of rabbit meat in central Kenya. He says that with the help of Juhudi, small-scale farmers have hope of creating wealth from their small pieces of land.

loans.use: For rabbit-keeping

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar lives in a 2-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan, which is a small city located in Punjab and famous for its leather industry. A talented lady, Kosar owns and operates an embroidery business at her home. She is an expert in her work. She primarily does work for her neighbors. She also sells bangles at her home. Her customers buy the bangles by matching them with their dress colors.
  
Her husband is A. M., a rickshaw driver. He generates an income for their family by providing transportation services to his passengers. Kosar has five children, all of whom are enrolled in a local school and get their education by attending different classes. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery and bangles business. With the loan, she will buy materials for embroidering, such as beads, colored thread, and clothes. She will also purchase bangles in larger quantities. That will enable her to fulfill the larger orders on time and to earn a good profit.
 
She is a very confident lady. She is very sure that after investing the loan money in her business, she will have more clients and, therefore, more income. She regularly uses Asasah, and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record and proved herself a responsible client.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials and bangles

loans.name: Reyna Del Socorro

texts.es:
El Sra. Reyna del Socorro S. M.. Es originario del municipio de santa rosa del peñón departamento de león se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en Santa Rosa del Peñón en el colegio José de la cruz Mena donde tiene 14 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de Compra de ladrillo y cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra. Con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
Esta señora su objetivo es plenamente dedicado a mejorar su hogar.
Esto le permitirá llegar a construir su propia casa de habitación donde mejorara el bien estar de su familia
texts.en: Mrs. Reyna del Socorro S. M. is from Santa Rosa del Peñón in the León region. She works as a primary school teacher in Santa Rosa del Peñón in the José de la cruz Mena school. She has worked there for 14 years.  This is the first loan she is requesting and it is to make home improvements.  She will use the loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and to pay for the labor necessary to improve her house. This loan will allow her to improve her home and to improve the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement and sand and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.es: El Sr. Melvin B. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como profesor de secundaria donde tiene once años de laborar en el Instituto José de la Cruz Mena. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc y pago de mano de obra para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en: Mr. Melvin B. is a native of the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón.  He currently works as a secondary school teacher at the José de la Cruz Mena High School where he has worked for eleven years.  This is the first loan he has applied for through Ceprodel.  It is for purchasing bricks, cement, sand, zinc and to pay for labor in order to improve the living conditions for his children.

loans.use: Purchase bricks, cement, sand, zinc and pay for labor.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix B. is from the village of Mercy Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 39 years old. Felix is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Felix provides motorela or motorized tricycle transportation services to local community members. Felix has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Felix joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the motorela. This will be the first loan taken out by Felix from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his motorela or tricycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: He wants to complete his stock

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita S. is from the village of Sta. Rosa. She is 59 years old. Pacita is married and has 12 adult children. To make a living, Pacita raises pigs for fattening and sale. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) when she sells a raised animal. In 2007, Pacita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Pacita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline B., from the village of Lagundi, Mambajao, Camiguin Province, is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, for over two years Caroline has been making and selling viands, especially Filipino delicacies such as ginataang monggo or green beans, vegetable lumpia, and sotanghon in the local community. She earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Caroline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan for 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients and use as working capital, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital and to purchase raw ingredients needed

loans.name: Abiud

texts.en:
Abiud N. is 34 years old and married with three school-aged children who all attend school. He has a dairy farm in Murang'a town, central Kenya where he has been farming for ten years.

Abiud has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 20,000 KES for breeding rabbits. This loan will help increase the household income for his family through the sale of rabbits. His biggest challenges have been drought and lack of enough animal feed. He hopes that in five years' time, he will have reached the level of national rabbit breeder.

He comments that Juhudi is giving hope to the poor through financial services that they cannot access through the banks.

loans.use: For breeding rabbits to sell

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey G. is 25 years old, married and has three school-aged children. He is from the village of Barangay Tucal in the municipality of Solano, Nueva Vizcaya province on the Luzon islands. Jeffrey raises pigs for breeding. He has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jeffrey joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. He successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase piglets. Jeffrey is requesting a new loan, his second from ASKI, of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B. is 46 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Maac, a part of Guinsiliban municipality within Camiguin province on the Mindanao islands. Lilibeth runs a store from which she buys and sells primarily fish like bangus, mackerel and sardines to the local community. Lilibeth has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from HSPFI, of 4000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold B., from the village of Balintawak, Mambajao, Camiguin Province, is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Arnold owns and operates a service-based business providing motorela or tricycle services to local community members. Engaged in his business for over two years, he earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arnold joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan for 5000 PHP to purchase tools for the maintenance of his tricycle, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools for tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia B. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 35 years old. Cresencia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cresencia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cresencia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Cresencia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rosalito

texts.en:
Rosalito D. is from the village of Mercy Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 26 years old. Rosalito is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Rosalito owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or tricycle services to local community members. Rosalito has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalito is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance of the tricycle. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for the maintenance of the tricycle (three-wheeled transport vehicle)

loans.name: Florence Nyambura

texts.en:
Florence has been farming in Olkalou town since the year 2001.  She is 58 years old, a widow and the mother of four children.  She has been raising her children alone since her husband died.

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Florence hopes to buy more land and practice mixed farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor Gutierrez, Sr. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 55 years old. Amor is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Amor owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Amor has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Amor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Amor is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Amor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna J. is from the village of Tupsan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Lorna is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling Filipino delicacies viands like "dinuguan" and "pancit guisado" in the local community. She is also buying and selling instant noodles and bananas. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for twenty years. Her farm produces coffee which she sells to the local market and milk which she sells through a local cooperative society. Her biggest challenges have been drought and lack of enough financing to venture fully into rabbit keeping.

She has requested this loan of 20,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo for rabbit keeping. The income from the sale of rabbits will help improve the livelihood of her family. In five years' time she hopes to be having over 300 rabbits of pure breed.

Jane is 43 years old. She is married with 4 children who are between the ages of 11 ans 23. Two of the children are currently attending school. She comments that with Juhudi's financial assistance the future is bright.

loans.use: For rabbit keeping

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica K. is a married woman. The husband is a chef and they have three children aged between seventeen years old and ten years old. Her business is located at a very busy market in Mwingi and it is known as cucu wa Kim. Veronica is served by the Thika branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. She owns a restaurant at which she serves food such as stiff porridge, meat stew, vegetables and githeri(mixture of maize and beans) to the local people. She has been in this business for one year now and has four employess. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is the high prices of food especially flour and vegetables. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business and meet the customers' needs. In the future, she hopes to open a hotel. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as hardworking, ambitious and patient.

loans.use: Flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Wilson Chege

texts.en:
Wilson has been farming in Olkalou town since 1996. He is 32 years old and married to Mirriam Wanjiru. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to plant more vegetables in his farm.

In the future, Wilson hopes to build rental houses to increase and diversify his income.

loans.use: To plant more vegetables on his farm.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn F. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 38 years old. Marilyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and raises livestock.
