  Es una Sra.  muy emprendedora, le gusta  la organización por eso  se le eligió como Presidena del grupo, se dedica en crías de animales (como chancho,gallinas .etc) y tiene 25 años con dos hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para  cubrir los gatos alimentación y sanitación de los animales.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliador committee was formed by various neighbors of Capiibary-11 de septiembre. All the members of the committee are self employed in activities such as sales, a general store, raising animals and others. The members have a tight-knit group that can jointly take on activities that contribute to their comraderie. When taking on loans doors are opened for the growth of their businesses. 

Germina R. Diaz Irala is a member and president of the group. She is very hard working and likes to be organized, reason for which she was elected as president of the group. She makes a living raising animals (pigs, chickens etc) and is 25 with 2 children. She is requesting a loan to help with expenses related to feeding and sanitation for her animals.

loans.use: Feed and sanitation expenses for animals.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 56-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has made his living as a taxi driver since 1980. His main route is between his town and the surrounding villages. He also takes private transportation requests from his clients. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to make much needed repairs to his taxi, including improving the car’s body and updating the paint. He says that he will be able to attract new customers to his business by making these repairs. His income from his taxi business is vital to the development and care of his family. In the future, he is hoping to purchase a new car so that he can continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to make much needed repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Taban

texts.en: Taban R. is currently in the business of selling cassava, sweet potatoes, and yams and is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour.  Taban is 26 years old and married; her husband is a teacher.  She has 3 children, and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize flour

loans.name: Musee

texts.en:
Musee K. is a 38-year-old fishmonger in Mtwapa, Kenya.  He is married to Magaret Musee, who is also a fishmonger and contributes to the family income.  They are blessed with five children.  K. has been in the fishmongering business for the last eight years, and business has been good thus far.

Musee was introduced to KADET, and he is now requesting his first loan, which he intends to use to buy sacks of charcoal for resale as a secondary business and to build a washing basin for his fish mongering business.  

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children, and he hopes to be successful in his businesses.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal for resale as a secondary business

loans.name: Sumbua

texts.en: Sumbua H. is currently in the business of selling onions, tomatoes, and cooking oil.  She is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions for sale.  Sumbua is 25 years old and married; her husband is a businessman.  She has 4 children, and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema R. is a 56-year old lady who is the sole proprietor of a business renting kiosks and houses to people in the Shanzu area of Mombasa. She is a widow who lives alone, and has been in this business for the last ten years. 

Neema's monthly income has been great, and now she is now requesting a second loan from KADET to start a fishing business venture. With this loan, she would like to purchase a boat engine and use the anticipated profits to renovate her rental houses. In the future, she would like to purchase more boats for her business.

loans.use: To buy a boat engine to start a new fishing business venture.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Lebanese Kiva borrower is a 47-year old married man and has four school-age children. He has been working as a professional taxi driver since 1985. His income from his taxi business is essential to the development and care of his family. His main route is between his town and the surrounding villages. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to perform much-needed repairs to his taxi, including improving the car’s body and engine after being in bad circumstances. He says that with the modifications, he will present a comfortable transportation service to his clients. In the future, he is hoping to expand his business by purchasing a new car.

loans.use: To perform much-needed repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Mick Onyango

texts.en:
Mick Onyango O. is a 40-year old secondhand clothes dealer in Kongowea, Mombasa. He has been in this business for the past year and his business is doing well. He is married to a woman named Vivian Achieng, who stays upcountry. She is a businesswoman who contributes to the family income. Together they are blessed with two children. 

Mick was introduced to KADET by a friend. He is now requesting his first loan to purchase more secondhand clothes for resale. He intends to expand his business with the anticipated profits. In the future, he hopes to lift his standard of living and succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en: Tabita T. is currently in the business of selling onions, bananas, and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.  Tabita is 23 years old and is married to a farmer. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Regina Nyambura

texts.en:
Regina Nyambura M. is a 31-year old lady married to Joseph Nganga, who is also a businessperson. They have two children. They live in Gitaru in Kikuyu, and their shop is situated along the highway where there is a constant flow of customers. Regina has been running the business since the year 2006, with a profit margin of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh) per month. 

Regina was introduced to KADET LTD by Mr. Mwaura, who is the chairman of an existing group of KADET. Having no history with any MFI, Regina is applying for her first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings which she intends to use to add more stock to her retail shop.

Regina hopes to diversify her business and raise funds to enable her to start poultry farming and be in a position to provide for her children.

loans.use: To add more variety to her stock, like margarine, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Susan Wambui

texts.en:
Susan Wambui M. is a 56-year old supplier of cereals and potatoes in Mwembe Tayari, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last year.  Susan is married to Fanuel Njagi, who retired a while back and lives on his pension savings. Together, they support seven members of their family.

Susan is now requesting her second loan from KADET to add more stock of cereals and potatoes for resale in her wholesale shop. She intends to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children who are still in school. In the future, she hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: To add more stock of cereals for resale in her wholesale shop.

loans.name: Adelaide Rosa

texts.pt:
Adelaide Rosa H. nasceu na província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 03 a 15 anos de idade os 3 mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pelos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua irmã enviando bens e dinheiro.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para cidade da Matola quando com a sua família a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de roupa de cama e carteiras, que adquire na Republica da Africa do sul e faz esta actividade ha mais de 10 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado conta com ajuda dos filhos, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria. (Bim). 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma conversa com uma cliente da instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 20.400.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria (panos, lencois, cortinas, roupa de cama, carteiras e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para construir uma banca fixa e deixar de ser vendedora ambulante.
texts.en:
Adelaide Rosa H. was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is married and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 3 and 15.  The 3 oldest go to school.  She finished 7th grade and didn't continue because of her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her sister by sending her goods and money.

She left the city of Maputo for the city of Matola when her family when they were searching for better living conditions.  She has her own business selling bedding and wallets which she acquires in South Africa.  She has done this for more than 10 years.  She doesn't have any employees, but 2 of her children help her.  She makes a monthly income of 4,000 meticais per month, which she puts towards her living expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account (Bim).

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a conversation with a customer of the organization.  This is her second loan in the amount of 20,400 meticais, which she will use to purcahse merchandise (towels, bedding, curtains, wallets, etc.) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

She is confident that she will make her payments ahead of time so she can ask for another loan so she can build a fixed stand and stop working as a traveling street vendor.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (towels, bedding, curtains, wallets, etc.)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth O. is 47 years old. She is from Migori town and is married with six children. Her husband repairs watches in Migori town and helps in the family's upkeep. For the past 20 years, Ruth has operated a cereals business. Through the years, she has created a huge clientele.

Ruth is an old client of KADET LTD and is now applying for her fourth loan with us. She really wants to buy several sacks of maize, especially in this peak season (normally in the months of October and November) when most farmers are harvesting. She will invest the profits she makes back into the business. Her main desire is to be able to build a house for her family in the next two years.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of beans and maize to add to her stock.

loans.name: Anisie

texts.en:
Anisie is 33 years old and married with three children, who are 3, 5 and 8 years old.  Anisie is well known for her business selling a variety of goods such as cosmetics, drinking water and some other beverages.  Anisie has been in her business for about 5 years.  The business hours are from 6 am to 10 pm every day.

Although Anisie has been in business for about 5 years, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To address this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, Irish potatoes, beans, etc.  If successful, Anisie will hopefully increase her sales as well as profits. This, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and will improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, Irish potatoes, beans, etc.

loans.name: Jane Adhiambo

texts.en:
Jane Ambok is 36 years old and a widow. Her husband died four years ago and she was left with the burden of taking care of their two children, now aged 15 and 12. They live in Migori town.

For the pst 13 years, Jane has had a business selling secondhand clothes. Her monthly income comes to 15,000.Kenyan shillings. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. Her desire is to see her business grow and she intends to use the money to help her buy five bales of used clothes to add to her stock. 

Her desire is to build her own house and cease from paying rent and living in rental houses.

loans.use: To buy five bales of clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Este comité se conformó con la unión de vaR. agricultores de la zona de Santani, para facilitar el acceso al crédito y ayudarse entre todos y pagar, se agruparon y denominaron al comité San Francisco.
Todos los integrantes se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, son pequeños productores de sésamo, mandioca, maíz, poroto y otros.
Todos muy trabajadores ya que procuran brindarles lo mejor a sus familias, especialmente la educación de sus hijos comentaron entre otras cosas.
El presidente del grupo es el señor Tomas S. quien además de ser agricultor también es docente de una escuela primaria donde ejerce medio tiempo.
Tiene plantaciones de vaR. cultivos y también cría de animales. Con este crédito piensa comprar balanceados para sus animales.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by the union of several farmers in the Santani area in order to facilitate access to loans and help each other and pay them back. They formed and named themselves The San Francisco Committee.

All members are dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry and are small producers of sesame, cassava, corn, beans etc.

All members hard-working and seeking to provide the best for their families, especially the education of their children amongst other things.

The group's president is Mr. Tomas S., who in addition to working as a farmer, also teaches at an elementary school where he works part time.
Various crops are planted and animals are bread. With this loan they plan to invest in their animals.

loans.use: Invest in livestock

loans.name: Hector Jesús

texts.es:
Hector Jesús L. V. tiene 48 anos. Es soltero y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos de 23 hasta 8 anos.
 
Hector es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Hector trabaja en la agricultura. Cultiva cacao y maíz. Su hijo hace las compras y las ventas de los productos. 

Solicita el crédito para cultivar un terreno (5 cuadraditos) de cacao. Es un terreno que tiene de herencia y recién lo esta empezando a cultivar. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría ampliar mas sus cultivos de cacao. Su sueno es mantener a sus hijos. 
Le gusta salir y divertirse en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Hector Jesús L. V. is 48-years-old.  He is single and lives in the Chillanes district of the Bolívar Province.  He has five children from 23-years-old to 8.  

Hector is a member of the rural solidarity group El Placer de Ser Amigos (The Pleasure of Being Friends) that is located 20 minutes from the parish of San Jose del Tambo.  There are 15 members in total, the majority of whom work growing cacao or with their own small businesses.

Hector works in agriculture.  He grows cacao and corn.  His son makes the purchases and sales of their products.

He is requesting the loan to cultivate a plot (of about 1.5 acres) of cacao.  It is a plot of land that he inherited and recently started to plant.  With the support of the loan he can expand his cultivation of cacao.  His dream is to support his children.  He likes to go out and have fun in his free time.

loans.use: Cultivate a plot of land (about 1.5 acres) with cacao.

loans.name: Violeta Cossa

texts.pt:
Violeta Cossa M. nasceu no Distrito de Moamba, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique viúva e mãe de 5 filhos de idades entre 12 a 26 anos de idade os 3 mais novos vão a Escola. Não fez o nível primário porque os pais na altura não davam prioridade a filhos de sexo feminino para ir a Escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Moamba para Nampula com seu marido quando este esteve em missão de trabalho, quando perdeu o marido volta a Maputo e inicia um negocio próprio de venda de capulanas. Onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda da pensão do marido consegue poupar algum em sua casa. 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, barrotes eoutros) para continuar com a obra de construção da sua casa.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para aplicar no seu negocio.
texts.en:
Violeta Cossa M. was born in the district of Moamba in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is a widow and the mother of 5 children whose ages range between 12 and 26.  The three youngest go to school.  She didn't finish elementary school because parents at that time didn't give priority to female children to attend school.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her grandchildren who live with her.

She left Moamba for Nampula with her husband to find work for him.  When she lost her husband, she returned to Maputo and started her own business selling capulanas (colorful skirts or wraps).  She makes a monthly income of about 4,000 meticais, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  With the help of her husband's pension, she manages to save some money in her home as well.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are clients of the organization.  This is her second loan in the amount of 15,000 meticais, which she will use to buy construction material (cement, sand, beams, etc) to continue building her home.

She is confident that she will make her payments on time so she can request another loan for her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction material (cement, sand, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Kerlyn Roberta

texts.es:
Kerlyn Roberta T. G. tiene 20 anos. Es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. 

Kerlyn es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.
  
Kerlyn es agricultura. Tiene siembras de cacao y maíz. Realiza las compras de sus productos en Mata de Cacao cada 15 días. Solicita el crédito para invertir en los insumos y abonos para el mantenimiento de cacao. Con el apoyo del préstamo podrá cultivar sus propios cultivos de cacao. Su sueno es seguir adelante con su trabajo agrícola. También espera terminar sus estudios universitarios. 

Le gusta escuchar música, ver televisión, y leer.
texts.en:
Kerlyn Roberta T. G. is 20 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in El cantón de Chillanes in the Bolívar Province.

Kerlyn is a member of the communal bank “El Placer de Ser Amigos”, which is located 20 minutes from the San José del Tambo parish. There are 15 members, the majority of which work farming cocoa or have their own small businesses

Kerlyn is a farmer.  She sows cocoa and corn.  She buys her products every 15 days in Mata de Cacao.  She is applying for the loan to invest in supplies and fertilizer to care for the cocoa.  With the help of the loan she will be able to grow her own cocoa crops.  Her dream is to make it as an agricultural worker.  She also hopes to finish her university studies.

She likes to listen to music, watch television and read.

loans.use: Invest in supplies and fertilizer to care for the cocoa

loans.name: Theonestine

texts.en:
Theonestine is 46 years old and married with three children, who are 2, 4 and 12 years old. Theonestine is a self-employed business woman who is well known for her business selling timbers. She has been in this business for about 9 years. Her business hours are from 7 am to 5 pm every day.

Theonestine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing additional timbers for sale. Hopefully, she will earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting so that she can buy a machine for cutting trees into timbers for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional timbers to sell

loans.name: Maria Da Gloria

texts.pt:
Maria da Gloria Afonso P. nasceu no Distrito de Guija, província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique viúva e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 16 a 24 anos de idade somente o ultimo vai a Escola. Fez somente 4ª classe não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua sobrinha que vive com ela.

Saiu de Guija para Maputo com o seu esposo quando este foi transferido pela empresa. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade e cerveja ha mais de 16 anos. Não possui empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e a consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria. 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, biscoitos, refrescos, cerveja e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para aplicar no aumento de alguns compartimentos da sua casa.
texts.en:
Maria da Gloria Afonso P. was born in the district of Guija in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique.  She is a widow and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 16 and 24.  Only the youngest goes to school.  Maria da Gloria finished the fourth grade but didn't continue with school due to financial difficulties.  She lives in her own home with her family and supports her niece who lives with her.

She left Guija for Maputo with her husband when his job was transferred.  She has had her own business selling basic goods and beer for more than 16 years.  She doesn't have any employees and she makes a monthly income of about 3,500 meticais, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are clients of the organization.  This is her first loan in the amount of 15,000 meticais, which she will use to buy products (rice, flour, cookies, soft drinks, beer, etc.) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

She is confident that she will make her payments before they are due so she can request another loan to expand some rooms in her home.

loans.use: To purchase products (rice, flour, cookies, soft drinks, beer, etc.)

loans.name: Telmo Nestor

texts.es:
Telmo Nestor L. E. tiene 57 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos de 36 hasta 26 anos. 
 
Telmo es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  
 
Telmo se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva todo un poco—cacao, arroz, soya, y maíz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Matilde de Ester. Se venden de la cosecha una vez al ano su arroz, soya, y maíz. 
Solicita el crédito para hacer más cacao y pagar los trabajadores de sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría seguir trabajando en la agricultura. Su sueno es superar un poco mas y poco a poco hacer mas cultivos. 

Dice que este año ha sido mas o menos con sus cultivos, y espera que el próximo ano es más productivo. 

No tiene tiempo libre. Su vida es difícil y trabaja 7 días a la semana.
texts.en:
Telmo Nestor L. E. is 57 years old and married.  He lives in the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar Province.  He has four children ranging in age from 36 to 26.  Telmo is a member of the “El Placer de Ser Amigos” (The Joy of Being Friends) Communal Bank.  It is 20 minutes from the San José Tambo parish.  There are 15 members in all.  Most of them grow cacao or have their own small businesses.

Telmo is a farmer.  He grows a little of everything; cacao, rice, soy, and corn.  He makes his purchases and sells his products in Matilde de Ester.  He sells his harvested rice, soy, and corn once a year. 

He is requesting to loan to grow more cacao and to pay his field workers.  With the help of the loan he will be able to keep farming.  His dream is to get a little better and to, little by little, grow more crops.

He says that his crops have been so-so this year, and he hopes that next year will be more productive.

He does not have free time.  His life is difficult, and he works seven days a week.

loans.use: Grow more cacao and pay his field workers

loans.name: Reina Verónica

texts.es:
Reina Verónica V. C. tiene 37 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 21, 16, y 6 anos.  

Reina es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Reina se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra cacao. Las compras de sus productos se realizan en Mata de Cacao cada 15 días. Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos como la semilla del cacao, fertilizantes y abonos para el mantenimiento de cacao. Con el apoyo del préstamo, realizaría su sueno de tener mas cultivos de cacao. Su sueno es darles una buena educación a sus tres hijos. 

En su tiempo libre, le gusta salir de paseo con su esposo y con sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Reina Verónica V. C. is 37 years old. She lives with her partner in Chillanes canton of Bolivar Province. She has three children who are 21, 16 and 6 years old. 

Reina is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos ("The Joy of Being Friends") group loan, whose members live 20 minutes from the San Jose del Tambo parish. There are 15 members in all, most of whom are cacao farmers or have their own small businesses. 

Reina works in agriculture. She plants cacao. She buys her products in Mata de Cacao every 15 days. She is requesting this loan to buy the cacao seeds and fertilizers she needs to maintain her cacao. With this loan, she will be able to achieve her goal of growing more cacao. Her dream is to give her children a good education. 

In her free time, she likes to go on outings with her husband and three children.

loans.use: Buy agricultural inputs such as cacao seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 47 years old and married. She owns a shop selling a variety of goods such as women's shoes, women's handbags and some other goods. Marthe has been in this business for a long time. The business hours are from 7 am to 7 pm every day except Saturday.

Although Marthe has been in this business for a long time, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully. To address this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing different kinds of shoes and bags for women. If successful, Marthe will hopefully increase her sales, and these sales will result in earning a lot of profit, which will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of shoes and bags for women

loans.name: Rosalia Antonio

texts.pt:
Rosália Antônio M. nasceu no Distrito de Xai-xai, província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique mãe de 6 filhos de idades entre 04 a 16 anos de idade somente o ultimo não vai a Escola. Não estudou porque os pais não deram oportunidade para tal. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua sobrinha que perdeu os pais e ainda menor de idade.

Saiu de Xai-xai para Maputo com o seu pai porque a mãe perdeu a vida apos o parto dela. Tem um negocio de produção e venda de blocos de construção civil ha mais de 15 anos, conta com ajuda do seu marido e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum em sua casa.

Ja teve empréstimo na cooperativa de credito CCP e decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material (cimento, areia, pó de pedra e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua produção.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este credito para poder aceder a outros e ampliar ainda mais o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Rosália Antônio M. was born in the district of Xai-Xai in the province of Gaz in southern Mozambique.  She is the mother of 6 children whose ages range from 4 to 16.  Only the youngest does not go to school.  Rosália didn't go to school because her parents didn't give her the opportunity.  She lives in her own home with her family and supports her niece who lost her parents and is still a minor.

She left Xai-Xai for Maputo with her father because her mother lost her life during childbirth.  She has had a business producing and selling bricks for residential construction for more than 15 years.  She has the help of her husband and makes a monthly income of 7,000 meticais.  She puts this towards her home's expenses and also saves some in her home.

She has had a loan in the past with the credit cooperative, CCP and decided not to continue with them.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are clients of the organization.  This is her first loan in the amount of 15,000 meticais which she will use to buy material (cement, sand, gravel, etc.) to increase her production.

She promises to pay back her credit to be able to request more in the future so she can expand her business even more.

loans.use: To purchase materials (cement, sand, gravel, etc.)

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra Patricia tiene 39 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica, lo más difícil para ella es la competencia, por lo que siempre brinda buen servicio y fue con el tiempo obteniendo clientes. Sandra tiene mucho carisma y eso es lo que más les gusta a sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. El deseo de Sandra es aumentar sus ingresos del negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en: Sandra Patricia is 39 and has two children. She makes a living with a small general store. She has been doing this for the past 5 years and the toughest part in the competition. That is why she provides excellent service and little by little has gained customers. Sandra is very charismatic and is what her customers like about her. The loan she is requesting is working capital to buy candy, soft drinks, juices, detergents and basic grains. Sandra's wish is to increase sales and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fausto Fernando

texts.es:
Fausto Fernando P. G. tiene 30 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus papas  en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar.

Fausto es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Fausto se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de cacao, soya, y arroz. Hace las compras de sus productos en Mata de Cacao y las ventas en Matilde Esther cada 15 días. Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos para el mantenimiento de cacao. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría seguir cultivando el cacao. Su sueno es seguir trabajando y seguir adelante con la familia. 

Le gusta practicar el deporte de Bolly Bol.
texts.en:
Fausto Fernando P. G., 30, is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.

He is a member of the “EL Placer de Ser Amigos” (The Pleasure of Being Friends) communal bank located twenty minutes from San José del Tambo parish.  It has 15 members who for the most part are cocoa bean farmers or small business owners.

Fausto is a farmer.  He has cocoa bean, soybean and rice crops.  He buys his products in Mata de Cacao and sells them in Matilde Esther every two weeks.

He is asking for funds to buy supplies for his cocoa bean crops.  Support from the loan will help him keep growing cocoa beans.  His dream is to continue working and making progress with his family.

He enjoys playing Volleyball.

loans.use: For crop care.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 40 years old and married with two children. Immaculee is well known for her business selling beverages and some pastries in her small shop. She has been in this business for about three years. The business hours are from 7 am to 9 pm every day.

Immaculee needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Immaculee will expand her business by purchasing more drinks, including beer, to satisfy the demand of her customers. Hopefully, she will earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. She will keep doing her best to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: For more drinks including beer to satisfy the demand of her customers

loans.name: Lucrecia Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Lucrecia Mercedes tiene 37 años, tiene  1 hijo menor de edad. Cabe señalarse. La señora se dedica a la venta de artesanía. A pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta como es el medio de transporte para trasladar los diferentes productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Este negocio ella lo inicio por sus abuelos que le enseñaron este medio de vida y que ella lo obtuviera como medio de trabajo y con el tiempo fue invirtiendo poco a poco hasta que le brindo ganancias mayores. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima pues tiene algunos pedidos. Su sueño es llegar a comprar una camioneta para trasladar su mercancía.
texts.en: Señora Lucrecia Mercedes is 37 years old, and has one son of school age. She knows how to stand out from the crowd, and dedicates her time to selling her craft work. She overcomes the challenges she faces, such as finding means of transport to take her different products to her customers. She started this business because of her grandparents, who taught her this way of life and work. Over time she has invested in it, so that little by little it has come to provide her with good earnings. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials, as she has various orders to fill. Her dream is to buy a pickup to transport her goods.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paulin

texts.en:
Paulin is a member of Ikinu Clean Shine group in Faulu, Kenya. 

For a living, Paulin practices poultry farming. She has been in this business for two years and she is glad to have a ready market for her chickens. She also does dairy farming for extra income. 

Paulin says that she is a hardworking lady and she hopes to grow financially. She hopes to be a great farmer with a big business in the future. She has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Jenifa K. is 23 years old and is married. Her husband is a chief. She has no children. She is currently in the business of selling bread.

Jenifa sells local Sudanese bread like lagemat, tamia, etc. She also sells tea in the local restaurants. 

Jenifa is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and bags of sugar. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a concrete restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith forma parte del banco comunal “Prieto Cruz” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella vende flores y comida rápida, como sopaipillas, hot dogs, sándwiches y empanadas, en un carrito frente al cementerio. Estas actividades las desarrolla hace 23 años, pero en esa ubicación trabaja hace 10 años. 
Su familia, es decir sus 3 hijas y sus yernos, también venden sus productos en ese mismo sector. Sus hijas también trabajan con Fondo Esperanza y sus negocios consisten en la venta de confites, helados y mote con huesillo.  
Con este préstamo Judith quiere comprar una máquina congeladora, para guardar sus productos comestibles. Su meta es apoyar y motivar a sus hijas para que crezcan en sus negocios y así puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Durante la tragedia del terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero, Judith perdió toda su mercadería, y afortunadamente su casa no tuvo daños. Ella está muy agradecida del apoyo que les dio Fondo Esperanza, haciéndose presente con ollas comunes (repartiendo comida a los emprendedores afectados) y tomando medidas de emergencia con respecto a los pagos de los préstamos. Judith ha sentido también un gran apoyo de parte de Fondo Esperanza, en relación a su negocio y a los de sus hijas, ya que gracias a los créditos y la educación, sus negocios han podido crecer. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Judith is part of the “Prieto Cruz” communal bank, in the city of Concepción. She sells flowers and fast food such as sopaipillas (deepfried pumpkin pastries), hot dogs, sandwiches and empanadas, from a stall in front of the cemetery. She has developed these activities over 23 years, although she has been in this location for 10 years. 

Her family - which is to say her three daughters and their children, also sell products in the same sector. Her daughters also work with [the field partner] Fondo Esperanza, and their businesses consist of selling sweets, icecreams, and mote con huesillo (a sweet drink / dessert made with peaches). With this loan, Judith wants to buy a freezer, to store her perishable foods. Her goal is to support and motivate her daughters in their businesses, so that they can grow and improve their quality of life. 

In the terrible earthquake that happened on 27th February, Judith lost all her stock, though fortunately her house was not damaged. She is very grateful for the support Fondo Esperanza has given them, being there with communal cooking pots (sharing food among businesspeople affected), and putting in place emergency measures in respect of loan repayments. Judith has also had great support from Fondo Esperanza in relation to her business and those of her daughters, as it is thanks to their loans and training that their businesses have been able to grow. 

Concepción sits at the mouth of the Río Biobío, one of the largest rivers in the country, in the south of Chile. It has played an important part in our history, being the site of important battles and settlements, especially duiring the Arauco War, thanks to its location on the edge of mapuche territory. Today the city is economically and demographically important. It is starting to be considered as one of the most important urban centres in Chile - in administrative, financial, and comercial terms - after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: Freezer

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is 40 years old and runs Jemuga Hardware shop. Her business is located in a very busy and heavily populated place so she gets lots of customers.  She has seven years' experience in her business and has learned how to retain them thanks to Faulu Kenya's training in good customer care. Currently, she has two employees. She hopes to open up more outlets for her business in the future. She has requested 50,000 Kes to buy cement and nails.

loans.use: To buy cement and nails

loans.name: Julia Elisa

texts.es:
Julia de 46 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa, su esposo es albañil con el tiene cinco hijos. Vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Inicio trabajando en una empacadora pero como sus hijos quedaban solos en casa porque su esposo salía a trabajar hasta tarde como albañil opto por dejar su puesto de trabajo e invertir sus ahorros en víveres para vender a sus vecinos y pasar mas tiempo con sus hijos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.    

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, verduras para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda bien surtida y poder readecuar su casa para tener mas espacio.
texts.en:
Julia is 46 years old, and has a store in the front part of her home, selling staple foods. Her husband is a bricklayer, and they have five children. She lives in an area of Guayaquil called las Orquídeas - now an urban area, it was named for the many varieties of orchids that grew there when the area was first discovered.

She started off working in a packing plant, but it meant that her children had to be home alone, because her husband had to stay out working until late. So she opted to leave her job and invest her savings in groceries to sell to her neighbours, and this way spend more time with her children. In reality it means she works from 6am until 10pm every day.

With the loan she wants to buy rice, sugar, and vegetables for her shop. In the future, she wants to have a well-stocked business and be able to expand her house to have more space.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, drinks

loans.name: Astamaiya

texts.en:
Astamaiya D. is 50 and married with three children aged 27, 25 and 18. In 2000, she established her furniture-making business. Working seven days a week, 9 hours a day, she suports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase wood and timber. In the future, Astamaiya plans to send her children to private school. She thanks you for your support.    

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans make raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets. With the help of a Kiva loan, a a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel tiene 22 años, tiene 1 hijo. La ubicación del negocio es de manera ambulante ya que recorre las calles para ofrecer sus productos. La actividad económica de ella es la venta de artesanía hace más de 6 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, ya que surgió porque a Maria es una mujer que le gusta trabajar fuertemente y es así como decide vender estos productos. Ella es una mujer humilde que disfruta de hablar con sus clientes y de ofrecerles buena calidad en productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar los materiales necesarios en sus productos y en comprar mayor cantidad. Los sueños de Doña Maria son de establecerse en su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 22 years old, and has one son. Her work is selling handicrafts, which has been her business for more than 6 years. She walks around the streets to offer her wares. She has been successful at it because she is a woman who enjoys working hard and decided to sell her products this way. she is a humble woman who enjoys talking to her customers and offering them good quality products. The loan she is seeking is to buy the materials needed in her products, and to buy them in bulk. Maria's dream is to establish a home for herself.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children who go to school. He has successfully managed his general store for nine years, thanks to Faulu Kenya's training in business record keeping. Peter dreams of becoming a wholesaler in the future. He has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy sugar, sweets, and maize flour for his store.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, maize flour, and sweets for his store

loans.name: C5285 Indatwa Group

texts.en:
Julienne is 32 years old and married with one child, who is 3 years old. Julienne is the only one who works in her family. That's the reason she has to work hard, so that she can provide whatever her family needs. She owns a small business selling various styles of clothes. She has 2 years of experience in this business. The hours of her daily activities are from 8 am to 5 pm every day except on Saturday. In addition, Julienne is the leader of a group of five people with different businesses.

Julienne and her group are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses by purchasing more products needed by their customers. With this loan, the group members will be able to earn enough profit to allow them to save money for their future.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela N. sells cassava flour and maize flour, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of flour to sell. She is 24 years old and is married to a farmer. She has one child who goes to school. With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to stock baking flour and start baking bread.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra integrada por mujeres muy trabajadoras quienes quieren salir adelante mediante el trabajo y ayuda solidaria de todas las integrantes. 
La Sra. Honoria es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la  venta de leche, queso y verduras. 
En fin realiza varias actividades, es una señora muy creativa en su actividad, y todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con varios  hijos y su marido trabaja en agricultura. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora  solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados etc.
texts.en: This committee is made up of very hard-working women, who want to succeed through hard work and the mutual solidarity of the group. Señora Honoria is one of the group members. She works selling milk, cheese and vegetables, among other activities: she is very creative in her approach to work, and her customers are impressed with her hard work. She has a very close family, with several children, and her husband works in agriculture. She is very satisfied with the group's work and with the training they have received. She is seeking the loan to buy animal feeds, etc.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina tiene 25 años, su estado civil es casada. Maria tiene 1 hijo y esta a su cargo. La actividad económica de Maria es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica en su pulpería ofrece los productos como granos básicos, cosméticos, ropa, verduras y pan y otros productos de consumo diario, durante este tiempo ha incrementado su negocio gradualmente satisfaciendo la demanda de su cliente. Los propósitos de ella son de aumentar su inventario para mantener su negocio y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Este crédito es para comprar productos de consumo diario. Sus deseos son que sus hijo pueda administrar el negocio y puedan defenderse para el día de mañana.
texts.en: Maria Cristina is 25 years old and married. She has one child in her care. Maria's economic activity is a general store. She has operated this business for more than 3 years. In her general store, she offers products such as staple foods, cosmetics, clothing, vegetables, bread and other products of daily consumption. During this time, she has gradually expanded her business to satisfy customer demand. Her goals are to increase her inventory to maintain her business and thus satisfy the demand of her customers. This loan is to buy products of daily consumption. Her desires are that her children will be able to manage the business and get by in tomorrow's world.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 46 years old and married with three children. He runs a butcher shop for a living. Most of his customers are local people. He has learned how to retain his customers by offering good service, thanks to Faulu Kenya's training in good customer care. Julius hopes to open more branches of his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice S. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs.  Joice is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a farmer. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs in her restaurant

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Fatmata.  She is married, and has three children ages 6, 10, and 12 years.  In 1998, Fatmata established her food items business.  She began her business to maximize her income, educate her children and create a savings account.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to add stock to her business by traveling to the neighboring country, Guinea.  

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000.  In the future, Fatmata plans to help her husband construct a house, educate her children and establish a savings account.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of grandnut for her business

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is 31 years old, married, and a mother of two children.  For four years, she has been selling groundnuts.  She is a member of Mothers Success group in Faulu, Kenya and has learned how to manage her business through her group members.  

She hopes to buy a piece of land in the future and to provide quality education to her children.  In five years, she wants to put up a cereal shop.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy groundnuts, charcoal, a cooking pot and an umbrella which she will use as a shelter in her business.  She plans to use the charcoal and cooking pot to fry groundnuts.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts, charcoal, a cooking pot and an umbrella

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Isatu.  She is married, and has five children who are 10, 12, 14, 16, and 18 years old.  

In 1995, Isatu established her food items business in order to generate income, educate her children and support her family overall.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to add stock to her business from the neighboring country, Guinea.  Isatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan. 

In the future, Isatu plans to buy land, educate her children and establish a savings account.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more containers of palm oil

loans.name: Liliette Ines

texts.es: Liliette, tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 1 hija, de 4 años de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante, generalmente vende los fines de semana y viaja entre semana para comprar mercadería a Managua.  Ella dio inicio con este negocio desde hace 3 años, fue su mama la que le enseño lo relativo al negocio de comercio, ya que ella vendía ropa y comerciaba en el mercado. Ella solicito este crédito con el objetivo de comprar más mercadea, para aprovechar la época de estos últimos meses, desea comprar desde ahorita ya que los precios no han incrementado tanto. Su sueño es llegar a comprar un tramo en el mercado, para vender más. Aduce, el crédito le ayudara a obtener más utilidades y ella confía ganarse los clientes a los cuales les distribuirá sus productos.
texts.en: Liliette is 27 years old, married and has one 4 year-old daughter. She sells general merchandise, which is distributed on an itinerant basis. She usually sells on weekends and travels during the week to buy goods in Managua. She started this business 3 years ago. Her mother taught her regarding the trading business, since she sold clothing and traded in the market. She requests this loan in order to buy more goods to take advantage of this selling season in these last few months. She wants to buy wholesale goods immediately as prices have not increased much. Her dream is to buy a stretch on the market to sell more. She argues that the loan will allow her to obtain more profits as she hopes to win customers who will distribute her products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 27 years old, married, and blessed with a 2-year-old child.  He does welding to earn a living.  

He was previously employed before he went into the business.  He has been running the business for six years with one employee.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has developed a savings culture.  He hopes to open a welding firm in the future.  He has requested 20,000 KES to add stock of raw material such as metals, and to buy another welding machine.

loans.use: To add stock of raw material such as metals and to buy another welding machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen L. O. is a newly registered member of Faulu Kenya under Kaza Moyo group. She runs a retail shop that is situated in the Kibera slums. Hence most of her customers are low-income earners. She was previously operating a grocery shop to earn a living. She hopes that someday, she will own residential houses. In five years, she wants to transform her business into a wholesale business. She has requested 20000 KES to buy cereals such as rice, beans and green grams (mung beans) to stock in her shop.

loans.use: To buy cereals such as rice, beans and green grams

loans.name: Jeanne D’ Arc

texts.en:
Jeanne d’Arc is 33 years old, married and has two children, who are 2 and 9 years old.  Jeanne d’ Arc has been in the business of selling timbers for a long time. Her business hours are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Jeanne d’Arc needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing additional timbers to sell.  Hopefully, she will earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting so she can buy a machine for cutting trees into timbers for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional timbers for sale

loans.name: Jessy Mabel

texts.es: La señora Jessy Mabel, es casada se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, además que distribuye de manera ambulante cosméticos, vestuario y calzado. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 5 años, ya que en ese tiempo no tenía un medio de ingreso ahora tiene su propio negocio. Empezó vendiéndole ropa y cosméticos a ciertas personas y poco a poco fue haciéndose de un buen inventario. Comentaba la señora, que algo que ella hace ahora es que solamente vende al contado, ya que muchas personas a las que les había otorgado crédito no le pagaron. Este préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra de  productos variados, principalmente para cubrir unos pedidos de cosméticos que actualmente posee. Su meta siempre ha sido tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Jessy Mabel is married and sells general merchandise; she’s also an itinerant cosmetics, clothing and footwear merchant.  She started the business five years ago because back then she did not have a source of income but now she has her own business.

She started out selling clothes and cosmetics to certain people and gradually acquired a good inventory.  She was telling us that something she does now is selling only for cash because many of the people she’d sold to on credit did not repay.

This loan will be used to buy assorted merchandise, especially to cover some pending cosmetics orders she has to fill.  

Her goal has always been to own a house.

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise, cosmetics in particular.

loans.name: Nyakiju Tukore B, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
K. Jovia of Nyakiju group is 54 years old and is a dedicated and hard-working agricultural farmer from Nyakiju, Rukungiri. She fattens cattle for a certain period, sells dairy products such as milk and ghee, and then sells the cows at a relatively higher price.
She has been doing this for 10 years and has been able to earn 185,000 Ugandan shillings a month. As a housewife she has been able to improve her family's situation by lifting their standard of living and educating her children. With this loan she is looking forward to purchasing ghee from fellow farmers to resell. This will earn her more sales revenue.

loans.use: to purchase ghee for resale

loans.name: Aminata B

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Aminata B K.. She is married and has three children aged 6, 9 and 12 years. In 2000, Aminata established her locally dyed gara and cotton cloth business in order to generate income and educate her children. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about  900000 SLL every month from this business. 

Aminata would like a loan in the amount of 3000000 SLL to add 15 new pieces of gara and two dozen new pieces of cotton, which she buys in neighboring Guinea. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 600000 SLL. 

In the future, Aminata plans to buy a motorbike to gain more contacts and increase her income. She hopes that this increased income will allow her to construct a house for her family, educate her children and establish a savings account. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cotton and gara cloth for resale

loans.name: C5284 Imirasire Group

texts.en:
Felix is 45 years old and married with three children: the first one is 12 years old, the next one is 7 and the last one is 6 years old. Felix is a businessman who works for his family. Felix has 3 years of business experience and he employs one person as a helper. In addition, Felix is the leader of a group of six people who have different businesses. Most of them are women, except Felix, who is the group representative.

Felix and his group are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses. He will purchase additional products such as beans, salt and rice for the store. With this loan, group members will be able to earn more profit to use for their families and in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more products for their store

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia, 36 years old, married and blessed with a four-year-old, has been selling second-hand clothes to earn a living for three years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to expand her business and save her money on a weekly basis.  Cecelia is now requesting 50,000 Kes to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa S. is 54 years old.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 40, 38 and 28.  In 2000, she established a tea shop.  She works 6 days a week, 5 hours a day, to support her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy ingredients for her business.  In the future, Champa plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called chiya pasals, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, Patan BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (Patan BPW).  In 2007, Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business-training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW or to join our lending team, visit our partner page on Kiva (Nepal > Patan Business and Professional Women), and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for a tea shop

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 29 years old and married with two children who are 5 and 6 years old.  Alice has owned a shop where she sells a variety of goods such as cosmetic goods, drinking water, foodstuffs, etc.  Alice has been in this business for about one year and her business hours are from 7 am until late in the evening.

Alice needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Alice will expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs. She really hopes that with these additional foodstuffs to sell, her profits will increase.  With these profits, she will keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability.  Additionally, she will keep improving the living style of her family and continue saving for their future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as beans, rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, etc...

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Goma D.. She is married and has three children who are 27, 23 and 20 years old. In 2005, she established her handicraft business. Working six days a week and five hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to purchase raw materials for her business.  

In the future, Goma plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: Nyakiju Tukore C, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
Hard-working, dependable and die-hard agriculturalist, M. Jennifer of Nyakiju group, is 35 years old. She has been maintaining a livestock farm, alongside milk and ghee sales, in her home area of Nyakiju, Rukungiri for more than 6 years. This fetches an average amount of 350,000 Ugandan shillings per month but is not enough to sustain her extended family.
Jennifer has persevered in keeping the enterprise going. Her aim for this loan is to restock her farm as part of her expansion plan to transport her products to bigger markets. This will help her to increase productivity, earn more revenue and enable her to live a more sustainable life and educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for fattening

loans.name: Premku

texts.en:
Premku D. lives in Chappagaun Village. She lives with her husband and their daughter. Her husband's name is Shyam D. and he is a farmer. Most of the people in this region are dependent on agriculture and farming. 

Premku D. is engaged in handicraft work. She makes different types of traditional sandals, which are made of thick cloth. Most of the people in Nepal use these types of sandals in kitchens. These types of sandals are also used in wedding ceremonies. She has three years of experience in this job. Mostly people use these sandals in the winter season. She supplies her products in Asan Market. Asan is one of the very busy bazaars of Kathmandu. Now Mrs. D. is requesting a Rs 25,000 loan to buy raw materials for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has five children who are 4, 7, 14, 17, 18 years old. 

Ibrahim established his fish vending business many years ago, in order to generate income. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. Ibrahim is very hard working and determined, and would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy fish in larger quantities. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 1,200,000.  

In the future, Ibrahim plans to sell fish wholesale to his colleagues. With his increased profit, Ibrahim plans to construct a home for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of dried fish for resale

loans.name: Priscila Albina

texts.es:
Priscila de 20 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). 

Realiza su trabajo sola para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos. También vende en una vitrina que tiene en su casa perfumes desde $ 15.00 hasta $ 35.00 c/u, ropa a $ 12.00. maquillaje de $ 14.00 c/u.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y asegurar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Priscila is 20 years old and lives in the Las Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil. She sells products from Yanbal (a company which gives entrepreneurial women the chance to start out with independent sales). 

She does this work only so that she can help with the family's expenses. She starts work very early, offering her products to her neighbors and friends. She also sells them from a display case in her home. She sells perfumes ranging from $15.00 to $35.00 each, clothing at $12.00, and makeup sets at $14.00 each.  

With the loan, she wants to buy Yanbal products such as perfumes, creams and deodorants. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and make sure she can finish her studies.

loans.use: Maquillaje, ropa, perfumes

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de  Yryvukua.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, cría de animales etc. 
Este comité ya están en su 2do ciclo, todo este tiempo demostraron puntualidad, solidaridad y  unión entres las compañeras.
Maria Librada A. F. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene  25 años de edad, con 2 hijos, es muy emprendedora, están en su 1er ciclo y gracias al Crédito y con la ayuda de su esposo Elvio  ahora ya tiene su propio quiosco, y cría de animales como, chancho, gallina etc. 
Pero en especial ella se dedica a la cría de cerdo, y solicita el préstamo para la ya que desea construir mejores porquerizas y de esa manera también su producción.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) committee is composed of several neighbors from Yryvukua.  All of the members are involved in independent activities like sales, fast food preparation, raising small farm animals, etc.

They are already in their second cycle and during all this time they have shown punctuality, solidarity and unity among themselves.

María Librada A. F. is group President.  She is 25 years old and has two children.  She is very enterprising.  She is in her first cycle and thanks to the loan and help from her husband, Elvio, she now has her own kiosk and she raises animals like pigs, chickens, etc. But, her specialty is raising pigs and she’s asking for the loan because she wants to build better pigsties thus increasing production.

loans.use: To buy mesh to build pigsties.

loans.name: Dhan Maiya

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Dhan Maiya D.. She is married and has two children who are 16 and 12 years old. In 2007, she established her agriculture business. Working six days a week and five hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys seeds and fertilizer. 

In the future, Dhan Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page 

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa de 55 años, la servicios de lavado para las ropas y vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Con su esposo y siete hijos viven en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Desde que se caso con su esposo ella lo ayudo económicamente para que pueda mantener a su familia, inicio lavando la ropa de sus vecinos en su lavadora poco a poco obtuvo capital para comprar productos de uso personal a Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En la actualidad tiene las dos actividades trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una lavadora y cremas, perfumes para que sus ingresos mejoren. En el futuro quiere tener un local para su lavandería.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old.  She runs a clothes laundering service and sells Yambal products (a company that offers women entrepreneurs the possibility to begin selling independently).  She lives with her husband and seven children in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (urban area called orchids because there were many orchid flowers when it was founded).

From the time she married her husband she has helped him economically to provide for the family.  She began washing her neighbors’ clothes in her washing machine.  Little by little she earned capital to purchase Yambal personal care products such as perfumes, creams and deodorants.  She is currently working both jobs from 7:30 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day.

She would like to buy a washing machine and creams and perfumes with the loan so that her income improves.  She would like to have her own  place for her laundering service in the future.

loans.use: Washing machines, perfumes and creams

loans.name: Mohamed L

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has one child who is three months old. 

In 2003, Mohamed established his food vending business to generate income and take care of his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 250,000 every month from this business.  

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to add another type of food item to his business, which will be sold at night. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to hire workers as demand is very high. He also plans to buy a motorbike to increase his number of customers and more easily travel around. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy eggs,vegetable oil, milk and sugar

loans.name: Meera

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Meera P.. She is married and has two children who are 14 and 12 years old. In 2007, she established her tailoring business.  Working six days a week and five hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. 

In the future, Meera plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children, as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Batamar Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de BATAMAR est créé le 15 octobre 2010 lors de son inauguration. Il est composé de 42 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Les deux principales activité du Banc Villageois est le petit commerce et le maraichage. 

Madame Fatou D. levant la main au milieu du groupe est Présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle a une expérience de plus de deux dans ce domaine d'activité.

Avec son premier crédit avec CAURIE-MF elle va étendre son activité pour accroitre ses bénéfices et réaliser une épargne.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en de la gestion familiale
texts.en:
The “Banc Villageois” of BATAMAR was created October 15, 2010 when it was inaugurated. It is made up of 42 women from the same village. The two main businesses of the Banc Villageois are retail sales and market gardening.

Mrs. Fatou D., who is raising her hand in the middle of the group, is the president of the Banc Villageois. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children. She sells vegetables. She has more than two years' experience in this business.

With her first loan through CAURIE-MF she is going to expand her business in order to increase her profits and have some savings. Her goal is to help her husband with the family management.

loans.use: Build a business selling vegetables

loans.name: Cotmu Group

texts.en:
Francois was born in 1964. He is married with six children between 16 and 9 years old. Francois has been a businessman for a long time just because he has four years of experience making bricks for construction. Francois is the group leader of 10 people with the same business. All of them make bricks for sale. This group is COTMU. They employ 100 employees from their community.

Francois and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their business of making bricks. With this loan, Francois and his team will be able to satisfy their market, which will make them more efficient and more effective.

loans.use: To expand their business

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es:
Erick de 29 años, tiene una papelería, vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos de 9, 8, 7, 3 y 1 años de edad en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas llamada Fortín.  

La esposa de Erick tenia experiencia en papelerías y por eso el decidió tener su propio negocio invirtiendo sus ahorros en papeles, cuadernos, plumas para su negocio. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar mas papelería y venderla a sus vecinos y conocidos. Una de las dificultades que tiene para trabajar es el polvo que genera la calle por donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería, cuadernos, zapatos, para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y darle un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Erick is 29 years old, he owns a stationery store and lives with his wife and 5 children ages 9, 8, 7, 3 and 1. They live in an area known for its dirt roads and the Fortín mountains.   

Erick's wife has had experience in stationery stores and thus decided to open their own by investing their savings in paper, folders, and pens for their business. Little by little with more effort he was able to buy more paper and sell it to his neighbors and acquaintances. One of the challenges he faces with work is the dust generated from the street where he lives.

With this loan he wants to buy stationery, folders and shoes for his business.  In the future he wants to finish building his house and provide a good future for his children.

loans.use: Purchase of stationery, folders and shoes.

loans.name: Candida Azucena
